title: I'll Declare Asset Like Buhari – Akufo-Addo
text:
Politics | 12 October 2015 19:06 CET I'll Declare Asset Like Buhari – Akufo-Addo By Daily Guide 
Nana Akufo-Addo has given the strongest indication he will publicly declare his assets when he wins power in 2016. 
Ghana's laws make it mandatory for political appointees to declare their assets, but it is sealed in an envelope and kept at the Auditor General's Department. 
However, the New Patriotic Party (NPP) flagbearer believes public declaration of assets deepens 'transparency' just as being spearheaded by Nigeria's Muhammadu Buhari. 
'I'm going to declare my assets to give accountability in the system,' the three-time presidential candidate of the Danquah-Busia-Dombo tradition told Accra-based Citi FM . 
'There is a clear understanding on the need for us to make these important gestures.' 
Akufo-Addo noted Buhari is on the right course and he is going to emulate the former military officer when he wins power. 
Meanwhile, President John Mahama has stated emphatically that all his ministers have declared their assets. 
Speaking to State-owned Twin City Radio in Takoradi in the Western region Monday, Mr. Mahama dismissed claims that he feels pressured to further deepen transparency in his government as a result of the public display of presidential transparency by Nigeria's Buhari. 
'I don't feel pressured. In fact Nigeria is now catching up. Our asset declaration law has been in place since and all our public officials are mandated to declare their asset. 
'As I understand, all my ministers have filed their assets with the Auditor General, they have all filed and it is confirmed,' he stated.
